moves.1. e4 b6: Black chooses to control the center from afar rather than occupy it.
moves.2. d4: Given the chance, White takes advantage of it.
moves.11... g6: Perhaps the purpose of this move was to prevent Nh5. Ironically, White plays Nh5 later in the game anyways.
moves.12. Qd2 c4 13. Bc2 a6: Preparing Queenside expansion, but Black's king is about to fall under attack.
moves.14. e5 dxe5 15. dxe5 Nd5: The only move to avoid losing a piece.
moves.16. Bh6 Rfe8 17. Rad1: Once again, the knight is pinned - this time on the d-file.
moves.18... Bf8: Probably not a good idea to exchange dark-square bishops.
moves.19. Bxf8 Rexf8 20. Qh6: Black's doomed. Nh5 is coming. If ... gxh5, then Qxh7 mate.
moves.20... Ne7 21. Nh5: If ... Nf5, Nf6+ ... Kh8 followed by Qh7#. If Kh8, then Qg7#. Black can't defend against the multiple threats.

gameName: Quick Win against the Hedgehog Defense
